alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 3:01PM AKST until December 24 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. Heavy snow is moving north this afternoon and will be over the northern inner channels tonight. The southern areas have reported from 4 to 8 inches of snow so far with more on the way before becoming a wintry mix or all rain by morning. A break or decrease in snowfall rates remains on track in the morning over the north as the second frontal band tracks into the southern panhandle Saturday morning. This front will continue to move north into the northern areas by the afternoon. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain for the central inner channels with the south changing to all rain through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero near White Pass. * WHERE...Municipality of Skagway. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with reduced visibility in blowing snow. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will increase through Friday evening. Additional light snow is likely Saturday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
